content:
Certainly! Here are a few more initiatives launched by the EU or European development banks that are more focused on Africa:

1. The European Investment Bank's Electrification Financing Initiative: This initiative was launched in 2020 and aims to support the electrification of rural Africa by providing financing for off-grid and mini-grid renewable energy projects.
2. The European Union's Clean Energy Programme in West Africa: This initiative was launched in 2021 and aims to support the development of renewable energy and energy efficiency projects in West Africa. The programme includes funding for the deployment of solar mini-grids and the adoption of energy-efficient technologies.
3. The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development's Sustainable Energy Financing Facilities: The EBRD has launched several Sustainable Energy Financing Facilities in African countries, including Egypt, Morocco, and Tunisia. These facilities provide financing for renewable energy and energy efficiency projects.
4. The European Union's Africa Renewable Energy Initiative: This initiative was launched in 2015 and aims to deploy 10 GW of renewable energy capacity in Africa by 2020. The initiative includes funding from the EU, African countries, and other international partners.
5. The European Investment Bank's Green Africa Power Initiative: This initiative was launched in 2019 and aims to support the development of renewable energy projects in Sub-Saharan Africa. The initiative includes financing for solar, wind, hydropower, and geothermal projects.

These are just a few examples of initiatives launched by the EU or European development banks that are more focused on Africa and supporting climate change and energy transition in the region.
